review: I love my AppleTV. It provides an amazing service that makes it much easier to part ways with your monthly cable TV bill. For just under a hundred bucks, you get access to Apple's entire media ecosystem, including the hottest TV shows and movie rentals in HD. You also get access to apps like Netflix, Hulu, and YouTube to round out your entertainment choices. And since all of this content is on demand, you don't even need a DVR.Setup and operation couldn't be easier. Just enter your Apple ID, your WiFi credentials, and you're good to go. Once you're online, it's easy to find what you're looking for. The menus are easy to navigate, and while typing in search terms with the included remote can be a chore, you can search for content.The two main drawbacks are 1) you won't find a lot of live content on AppleTV and 2) you can't sit back and channel surf (though in some ways, that's arguably a good thing). A simple HD antenna can do the trick for the major networks, but for events like basketball, you might be out of luck. And while you can purchase NBA, MLB, and NHL packages for use with AppleTV, licensing agreements black out a lot of the games you'll want to see anyway.That said, the amount you save by using and AppleTV over your cable TV service can't be overstated. Even if you purchase four or five seasons of your favorite TV shows and rent a couple of movies, depending on what cable TV package you have, you could easily save anywhere from $500-$900 a year. That's a lot of money. And even if you do decide to stick with your cable TV subscription, movie rentals and access to Netflix and Hulu on your TV still make AppleTV a compelling purchase.
